Week 4

Bhaswar Chakma

23 Feb 2021

Objectives

  • R Script

  • Working Directory and RStudio Project

  • Read Data

  • Explore

R Script

  • <- : your best friend, the assignment operator.
  • = does the same job. DO NOT USE IT!
  • #: write comments

Let’s fire up RStudio!

Working Directory and RStudio Project

Where are your files?

getwd()

Change location?

setwd()
  • Windows: Copy the path
    • use \\ or change to /
  • Mac: Just copy the path
    • Don’t know how? Google!
  • Example: setwd("C:/Users/JimiHendrix/Desktop")

A wise and common practice

  • Use RStudio Project

Instruct RStudio not to preserve your workspace between sessions

Click Tools then Global Options...

Read Data

Files:

  • Text
  • Excel

Packages Required:

  • readxl
  • readr

Steps:

  1. Go to the Environment pane
  2. Click Import Dataset
  3. Select the file type
    • From Text(readr) or
    • From Excel
  4. Locate the file; If needed, modify the options; Done!

Data:

  • Create a folder data in your project directory.
  • Click here to download or check in Teams/Files.
  • Save them in the datafolder.

Explore

Let’s install the tidyverse

  • It is a set of packages. More info here.

  • install.packages("tidyverse")

Today we will use the following packages:

  • dplyr: use the functions select(), filter() and arrange()
  • magrittr: use the pipe operator %>%

Example

Inspect the file mcap20210221.xlsx.

library(dplyr)
library(readxl)
read_excel("data/w4/mcap20210221.xlsx", sheet = "global100b") # i put my data in the subfolder w4
## # A tibble: 157 x 5
##    `Updated at 19:~ `Company Common~ `Company Market~ `Country of Hea~
##    <chr>            <chr>                       <dbl> <chr>           
##  1 DE.N             Deere & Co                   104. United States o~
##  2 VOWG_p.DE        Volkswagen AG                110. Germany         
##  3 AXP.N            American Expres~             106. United States o~
##  4 IBM.N            International B~             106. United States o~
##  5 UNP.N            Union Pacific C~             140. United States o~
##  6 AAPL.OQ          Apple Inc                   2180. United States o~
##  7 MCD.N            Mcdonald's Corp              158. United States o~
##  8 NKE.N            Nike Inc                     224. United States o~
##  9 TSLA.OQ          Tesla Inc                    750. United States o~
## 10 PRX.AS           Prosus NV                    212. Netherlands     
## # ... with 147 more rows, and 1 more variable: `TRBC Industry Name` <chr>
df_global <- read_excel("data/w4/mcap20210221.xlsx", sheet = "global100b")

##  2 VOWG_p.DE         Volkswagen AG       110. Germany           Auto & Truck Ma~
##  3 AXP.N             American Express ~  106. United States of~ Consumer Lending
##  4 IBM.N             International Bus~  106. United States of~ IT Services & C~
##  5 UNP.N             Union Pacific Corp  140. United States of~ Ground Freight ~
##  6 AAPL.OQ           Apple Inc          2180. United States of~ Phones & Handhe~
##  7 MCD.N             Mcdonald's Corp     158. United States of~ Restaurants & B~
##  8 NKE.N             Nike Inc            224. United States of~ Footwear        
##  9 TSLA.OQ           Tesla Inc           750. United States of~ Auto & Truck Ma~
## 10 PRX.AS            Prosus NV           212. Netherlands       Online Services 
## # ... with 147 more rows
# Does anything get stored?
# Nothing gets stored; you just see output
df_global2 <- rename(df_global, mcap = 3)# now check!

###############################
# Many variables to be renamed?
###############################
# Pipe operator: %>% 
# Windows: ctrl + shift + m
# Mac: cmd + shift + m
names(df_global)# Let's check the names again
## [1] "Updated at 19:02:34"     "Company Common Name"    
## [3] "Company Market Cap"      "Country of Headquarters"
## [5] "TRBC Industry Name"
df_global %>% 
  rename(code = 1,
         cname = "Company Common Name",
         mcap = "Company Market Cap",
         country = "Country of Headquarters",
         industry = "TRBC Industry Name")
## # A tibble: 157 x 5
##    code     cname                     mcap country           industry           
##    <chr>    <chr>                    <dbl> <chr>             <chr>              
##  1 DE.N     Deere & Co                104. United States of~ Heavy Machinery & ~
##  2 VOWG_p.~ Volkswagen AG             110. Germany           Auto & Truck Manuf~
##  3 AXP.N    American Express Co       106. United States of~ Consumer Lending   
##  4 IBM.N    International Business ~  106. United States of~ IT Services & Cons~
##  5 UNP.N    Union Pacific Corp        140. United States of~ Ground Freight & L~
##  6 AAPL.OQ  Apple Inc                2180. United States of~ Phones & Handheld ~
##  7 MCD.N    Mcdonald's Corp           158. United States of~ Restaurants & Bars 
##  8 NKE.N    Nike Inc                  224. United States of~ Footwear           
##  9 TSLA.OQ  Tesla Inc                 750. United States of~ Auto & Truck Manuf~
## 10 PRX.AS   Prosus NV                 212. Netherlands       Online Services    
## # ... with 147 more rows
# store it as df_global
df_global <- df_global %>% 
  rename(code = 1,
         cname = "Company Common Name",
         mcap = "Company Market Cap",
         country = "Country of Headquarters",
         industry = "TRBC Industry Name")
# remove df_global2
rm(df_global2)
######################
# How many industries?
######################
table(df_global$industry)

#################################################################
# Get data for only Pharmaceuticals; Lowest & Largest Market Cap
#################################################################
df_global %>% 
  filter(industry == "Pharmaceuticals")
## # A tibble: 12 x 5
##    code     cname                    mcap country                 industry      
##    <chr>    <chr>                   <dbl> <chr>                   <chr>         
##  1 AZN.L    AstraZeneca PLC          133. United Kingdom          Pharmaceutica~
##  2 NOVOb.CO Novo Nordisk A/S         134. Denmark                 Pharmaceutica~

##  8 ABBV.N   Abbvie Inc               185. United States of Ameri~ Pharmaceutica~

## 11 PFE.N    Pfizer Inc               191. United States of Ameri~ Pharmaceutica~
## 12 JNJ.N    Johnson & Johnson        429. United States of Ameri~ Pharmaceutica~
# Lowest Market Cap; use arrange()
df_global %>% 
  filter(industry == "Pharmaceuticals") %>% 
  arrange(mcap)
## # A tibble: 12 x 5
##    code     cname                    mcap country                 industry      
##    <chr>    <chr>                   <dbl> <chr>                   <chr>         
##  1 SASY.PA  Sanofi SA                117. France                  Pharmaceutica~
##  2 AZN.L    AstraZeneca PLC          133. United Kingdom          Pharmaceutica~
##  3 AMGN.OQ  Amgen Inc                134. United States of Ameri~ Pharmaceutica~
##  4 NOVOb.CO Novo Nordisk A/S         134. Denmark                 Pharmaceutica~
##  5 BMY.N    Bristol-Myers Squibb Co  136. United States of Ameri~ Pharmaceutica~
##  6 ABBV.N   Abbvie Inc               185. United States of Ameri~ Pharmaceutica~
##  7 MRK.N    Merck & Co Inc           188. United States of Ameri~ Pharmaceutica~
##  8 PFE.N    Pfizer Inc               191. United States of Ameri~ Pharmaceutica~
##  9 LLY.N    Eli Lilly and Co         193. United States of Ameri~ Pharmaceutica~
## 10 NOVN.S   Novartis AG              218. Switzerland             Pharmaceutica~
## 11 ROG.S    Roche Holding AG         293. Switzerland             Pharmaceutica~
## 12 JNJ.N    Johnson & Johnson        429. United States of Ameri~ Pharmaceutica~
# Largest
df_global %>% 
  filter(industry == "Pharmaceuticals") %>% 
  arrange(- mcap) # or arrange(desc(mcap))
## # A tibble: 12 x 5
##    code     cname                    mcap country                 industry      
##    <chr>    <chr>                   <dbl> <chr>                   <chr>

##############################
# keep only required variables
##############################
# suppose we only need cname and mcap
df_global %>% 
  select(cname, mcap)
## # A tibble: 157 x 2

##    <chr>                                <dbl>

Exercises

Always inspect the file!

Exercise 1

File: mcap20210221.xlsx; Sheet: global100b

Questions
  1. Largest firm?
  2. Create a new data frame df_banks, containing banks only.
    • Largest bank?
    • Find summary statistics
    • Which country has the largest share?

Exercise 2

File: mcap20210221.xlsx; Sheet: pt

  • Store it as df_pt
  • Use the same names e.g. mcap is Company Market Cap
Questions
  1. Largest firm?
  2. Create a new data frame df_pt_leisure, containing firms that are in Leisure & Recreation industry
    • Largest firm?
    • Smallest firm?
    • Find summary statistics
